nodes.bodyText: There's no need for an array copy here new ArrayList<>(getRank(rank)) should just be getRank(Rank)
I believe this is how the corresponding loop was coded before I rewrote the mayoral succession system.
This should be resolved as of 9606f94.
This should also be resolved as of 9606f94.

this should probably just return resident.hasTownRank("assistant"); and the hasRank() method below can be scrapped. Eventually I want all of the assistant stuff removed from being hardcoded, including the saving/loading assistants in the DB.

Oh yeah, I used it in Town.findNewMayor(String rank).  I'm not sure why I set up Town.hasRank(Resident resident, String rank)that way except that that was the wayTown.hasAssistant(Resident resident)` originally worked.
Commits ea3df36 and fb20ac2 resolve this.

What Javadoc? Most of Towny, including (Town.hasAssistant()) is
undocumented and the replacement is obviously the code the method is
functioning as an alias to for.
